III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12211 Privacy safeguard
Section (1) An agency shall safeguard the privacy of a child and his or her
Description family.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that an agency Worker violated confidentiality.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed via telephone on June 29,
2023. The Complainant reported that she was attending a Court
hearing on June 20, 2023, regarding the adoption of a sixteen-
year-old male. At that time the agency adoption worker, hereafter
referred to as Staff 1, was attending the Court hearing via video
on her cell phone. The Complainant reported that Staff 1 was in a
car traveling at the time she was attending the Court hearing while
another unidentified person in the car was driving. The
Complainant reported that she did not know who the driver of the
car was and expressed concern that a breach of confidentiality
had occurred as specifics of the case, including the identity of the
adoptive son, were disclosed during the Court hearing.
The agency Child Welfare Director was interviewed via
telephone on June 29, 2023. The Child Welfare Director was
informed of the allegation. The Child Welfare Director reported
that on the day of the Court hearing Staff 1 and Staff 2, an agency
foster care worker, were in an agency car conducting visitations
and agency business. The Child Welfare Director reported that
Staff 1 was attending the Court hearing via her phone and Staff 2
was driving the vehicle. The Chief Administrator reported she was
aware of the compliant and had confirmed with Staff 1 and Staff 2
that they were only occupants in the car when the Court hearing
had taken place.
The agency Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via
telephone on July 28, 2023. The Foster Care Supervisor
reported that he is the supervisor of Staff 2. The Foster Care
Supervisor reported that he had spoken with Staff 1 and Staff 2
and they confirmed that they were the only occupants of the
vehicle at the time of the Court hearing.
2

Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on July 31, 2023. Staff 2
reported that she was the driver of the vehicle on the day of the
Court hearing when Staff 1 was attending via her cell phone. Staff
2 reported that there were no other occupants in the car during the
Court hearing.
The Adoption Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
July 31, 2023. The Adoption Supervisor reported that she is the
supervisor of Staff 1. The Adoption Supervisor reported that she
had spoken with Staff 1 and Staff 2 and they had reported that
there were no other occupants in the car at the time of the Court
Hearing.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on July 31, 2023. Staff 1
reported that she and Staff 2 were the only occupants of the car at
the time of the Court Hearing. Staff 1 added that she had informed
the Court at the beginning of the hearing that she was in a vehicle
with another agency worker and that worker was driving.
Analysis The Compliant reported that she did not know the identity of the
driver of the vehicle. Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported they were the
only occupants of the car during the Court hearing. Staff 1
reported that she had informed the Court at the beginning of the
hearing that another agency worker was in the car and was the
driver of the car. The Child Welfare Director, Adoption Supervisor,
and Foster Care Supervisor reported that Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
the only occupants of the vehicle during the time of the Court
hearing.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
